forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. South wind around 20 mph, with gusts as high as 36 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy. Low around 49, with temperatures rising to around 51 overnight. South southwest wind 9 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening deepens over Downtown San Francisco, the city is enshrouded in a gentle yet persistent rain, with clouds draping the skyline, stealing away any last remnants of sunlight. A cool breeze carries whispers of warmth against the chill, but with temperatures settling around the mid-forties, the air feels crisp. Visibilities may be reduced, awash in a veil of moisture; it is here the fog may creep in, lapping at the edges of iconic views, though its presence is subtle tonight.

With a night such as this, it seems fitting to embrace the cozy comforts of home. One might slide into a favorite sweater, perhaps a light waterproof jacket to fend off the drizzling rain for those who must venture out. On a day where the skies are unwilling to part, curling up with a good book or catching up on a series feels far more appealing than braving the weather. If you find yourself compelled to step outside, consider a leisurely stroll under an umbrella, delighting in the rhythmic patter of raindrops—there is a soothing serenity to be found in the midst of the storm, a chance to reflect as the city dances in raindrops’ glisten.
